body.name: WADEO 6800W Windproof Camping Gas Stove, Small Camping Stove with Piezo Ignition, 1LB Propane Tank Adapter, Butane Adapter for Outdoor Cooking, Picnic, Camping and Hiking
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 3 hrs 47 mins
features: 🍳Unique Burner: Compared with stainless material of other brand, the burner of our camping stove is made of brass, consisted of three brass burner, the brass core has a high temperature resistant and anti-corrosion, it is more durable and it will not oxidize black after long time use.

☕Strong Power and Windproof Design: With high power of up to 6800W, the camping stove heats faster, which helps finish cooking in a short time and improve efficiency. It takes less than 2 minutes to boil 1L water. And the windproof design provides an efficient prevention to wind, which helps improve burning efficiency and save gas fuel.

🫕Upgraded Piezo Ignition and Flame control Knod: The ignition needle position plus a baffle so that it's easier to ignite the gas. The backpacking stove's flame control knod has a long handle, it is more convenient to adjust the flame size.

🚵Compatible with 3 Kinds of Gas Canister: Our backpacking stove is compatible with isobutane, butane and 1lb propane fuel canister. You can choose the appropriate adapter according to the needs. In addition, the hose of the camping stove is lengthened to 50cm, which is longer than other stove with only 30cm hose. The distance between the stove and the gas cylinder is farther and safer when using.
🏕️Widely Used: This camp stove is suitable for most cooking utensils, such as pot, cooking ware pot, coffee pot, kettle and frying pan. It's a great helper during your trip.
💖 We provide 1-year warranty, Please feel free to contact us if there’s any question and we will get back to you ASAP.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice portable stove
reviews.reviewText: Really puts out good flame and heat! I use it for ice fishing when I need hot tea or coffee to warm up. The igniter works well too. Definitely recommend this stove.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I love how smaller and compact this product is! This is the perfect backpacking set up. Very light weight, durable, and easy to carry. Take this every where we go camping.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The igniter stoped working after second time using but not a deal breaker, just light it with a lighter

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Tiny, dandy, and good price.
reviews.reviewText: Job #1 is buy an adapter for a 20 lb propane tank to refill your used bottles as they are getting more and more pricey. Dual fuel, but using the 1 lb tanks and the whole rig fits into a wee sack. Compared to the stout Coleman single burner, it's a midget and yet it does the job. Think you'll like using this.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars The return policy is a lie
reviews.reviewText: Overall 1 star just because the return policy is a flat out lie. I wasn't sure if I'd like this stove, I verified the return policy said "Eligible for refund or replacement" before I bought it. It's actually a great stove, works perfectly and is well-built. It has adapters to fit any fuel source, very stable, very powerful. But for my needs, it's TOO powerful. The flame is so wide and hot that it heats up the extended pot holders on my 750ml pot so I can't touch them to pour out the hot water. I should have gotten something smaller like a pocket rocket. So I tried to return it, but got the message this item is not eligible for returns. LIARS! I'll probably just donate it to Goodwill.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Simple and effective
reviews.reviewText: Great product for the cost. I have had many campstoves and backpacking stoves over the years. All of them have their pro's and con's. This is an excellent little unit. I highly recommend it. Given the size of the burn element, I think it should have a wider support to prevent tipping, but with care it is manageable.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars UPDATE TO PREVIOUS REVIEW
reviews.reviewText: UPDATE: A company representative reached out to me regarding my concerns about the melted igniter. They have checked with their supplier and apparently the igniter button just didn't work using anything other than plastic. So, the lesson learned is not to completely enclose this little stove particularly around the area of the igniter. Use a windscreen just make sure there is plenty of area left for the residual heat build up to escape without super-heating the igniter. The company was more than willing to provide a refund as well as telling me to simply keep the product - although the igniter no longer works it can still be lit with a match or other flame source. I appreciate that the company reached out to make good and stand behind their product. And, they assured me that they would do so with any customer who had a problem - they simply ask that you reach out to them directly. So, I am now a happy camper. :o)PREVIOUS REVIEWDo NOT use this product with a windscreen as recommended by several of the reviewers - the igniter is not made of ceramic/metal as it should have been - but includes plastic which quickly melted the first time I used it. Not fatal as it can still be started with a lighter - but clearly a product limitation since many will be using it with a windscreen not realizing that it will cause igniter failure. The biggest issue here is that the company does not stand behind its product in that it will not allow you to return it nor do they offer replacement just a bunch of DIY instructions for troubleshooting that DID NOT address the product failure issue. Regrettably, I did NOT see the "NO RETURN" policy statement in the Website - if it even appeared there and if it did it certainly is not highlighted for the consumer. This is clearly a "BUYER BEWARE, PROCEED ENTIRELY AT YOUR OWN RISK" product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars The only thing wrong with this neat little stove...
reviews.reviewText: It is very stable. It is compact, but still slightly larger than I expected. It held my small frying pan perfectly. I love that the connection is on a hose and the adapters can accommodate all types of cannisters. My only complaint is that the legs get extremely hot. They are also the pan rests, so the heat travels down quickly. This stove needs to be set on level ground or a flat rock, not a plastic cutting board.

I am a vanlifer and use this as both an on-the-road backup to my BBQ and at home for when the power goes out and I need coffee;-).Like: does exactly what it says it will do and feels of great qualityDislike: can only put a small pot on it as it is small...but then again, it's enough for what I need 95% of the timeSurprise: when you get the box, it is SO SMALL I laughed out loud. But then again, it works!When on "full throttle" it sounds like a jet engine on a plane, kind of scary but works really well. Perfect for back-packing and camping IMHO

reviews.reviewTitle: Fast shipping and seems decent quality
reviews.reviewText: Picked up this stove for emergency use with the propane conversion as well for extra choices. I found some re-fillable propane tanks as well that I'll likely get one or two for camping.

Amazing thing is that you have Propane and Butane adapters out of the box. I use this stove with refillable propane cylinder.The stove is really powerful, when you give more gas it sounds (and heats) as a rocket :)But this is also a drawback: all camping neighbors hear that you are cooking. I assume the sound is created, because this stove has three small nozzles rather then 1 bigger.I tried to use it to fry potato on cast iron pan: you shoud not set too high power, because the pan's center is beign warmed much faster then sides.I like that it is assembled into a cubic box with 10cm side.Don't forget to let it cool down after use. it is really hot.Overall:Pros: small, powerfull, universalCons: noisy,
Works good, but the metal handle very hot

Great stove for backpacking or even connecting a 20lb propane tank for more usage. It comes with a 1 lb propane adapter and a butane one as well. The only downside is that, the stove is extremely light and the legs get warped after a few uses after which you can't really fold it and put it back in its box.
